Question: Although **** won the first ballot, Heseltine attracted sufficient support (152 votes) to force a second ballot.
Hints: Billy Bragg and Paul Weller helped to form the Red Wedge collective to support Labour in opposition to this person.
This person returned to the backbenches as MP for Finchley for two years after leaving the premiership.
The Conservatives won a 44-seat majority in the House of Commons, and this person became the UK's first female Prime Minister.
